name: St. Vincent of Lérins
summary: Vincent of Lérins was a monk and theologian known for his 'Commonitorium,' in which he formulated the famous principle: 'What has been believed everywhere, always, and by all' (quod ubique, quod semper, quod ab omnibus). This became a key criterion for orthodoxy.
keyQuotes: We hold that which has been believed everywhere, always, and by all.
